comments.body:
having these be flags means it's easy to end up specifying mutually-exclusive flags.
Maybe `--build-mode=debug` or some such?
But that's non-ergonomic.
If we stick with flags, we should be very elaborate in our handling of the situation where mutually exclusive flags are given at the same time.
`--build-mode=debug` would be clearer but more to type. I'll add some checks in the `getBuildMode()` call below to handle mutually exclusive flags.
By starting this here, we'll record the time it takes to update the cache if needed (which is done in `verifyThenRunCommand()`), which will mess with the analytics results...
Ditto. I think that's fine as a metric to optimize for.

Is usageValue perhaps a bit vague? Since it's in FlutterCommandResult, we might still want to mention that it's analytics related. Perhaps this should replace the original name of 'analyticsParameter' or 'analyticsDimensions' or some such.
the other variable was usagePath, so I kept with "usage". We could refactor both names?
